channel.title: School Shootings
channel.description: Last Monday, on April 16, 2007, the worst school shooting in history happened in United States, killing 32 victims. For more information, visit [url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21592523-661,00.html]http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,21592523-661,00.html[/url].

item.title: School Shootings
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

goatee:

ADD is a load of crap … its just a stupid excuse to be an idiot and piss about in school.

Personally I believe ADD exists, just that it’s pretty overdiagnosed and maybe used as an excuse by some. As for “why do they keep handing it out” - because its pretty effective in people with real cases of ADD. A few people may have a bad reaction to it, but is that any reason to stop all the people it would help from being allowed it? Many more people have reactions to opiates, so if you ever get hit by a bus, make sure you refuse the morphine

Read full topic

item.title: School Shootings
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

exe626:

I don’t know if its been mentioned before, but if you look back on past events you would notice all of the people who had a massacre and end up killing them selves, are usually on rillilian(sp?). Its a medicine to help depression, or something like that, right? My friend Courtney was on it for about a week and it gave her suicidal thoughts, and me and my friends told her not to take it anymore. If people know what the medicine dose to people, why do they keep handing it out? Its so irritating to know that your doctors, our doctors are causing people to kill one another and want to kill them selves.

Neuropharmacology is nowhere near as clear-cut as “this will make you think suicidally” “this won’t” “this will cure your depression” “this won’t”. People rip the shit out of doctors for making mistakes with medication all the time, without realising humans know a lot less about the brain than they realise. Sure, we’ve named some neurotransmitters and figured out roughly what they do and how we can manipulate them, but why would drug a cause massive amounts of neurotransmitter b to be produced in most of the population, but cause something completely different to happen in person c?

Doctors are keeping up a constant juggling act most of the time, and I have respect for the job they’re doing. (Real doctors that is, not your fkn “oh, chest infection!” type)[br][size=1]Posted on: April 25, 2007, 01:43:50 PM[/size][hr]Oh, and what was “rillilian” supposed to be? I’m curious.

Read full topic

item.title: School Shootings
item.dc:creator: @TeraByte TeraByte
item.description:
@TeraByte wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:31, topic:82681”][quote author=mOPoTaToZ link=topic=121481.msg1206950#msg1206950 date=1177384150]
Another thing, the teachers and students admitted that he was made fun of and bullied. He was asked to read from a book out loud, and he had a speech problem, so the kids said “go back to china”. I’ve seen the video that was on NBC, and you can tell he DID have a mental problem, or was just very high. He contradicted himself many times. He said he was doing it for the weak and defenseless, yet he killed the weak and defenseless.
[/quote]

So what? I have been bullied and made fun of, back around 5th grade or so I used to stutter sometimes in class and got made fun of because of it. I was also made fun of because my parents didn’t have as much money as some other kid’s parents did. Did I ever even consider bringing a gun or any other weapon to school and killing people? (I certainly had access to guns, my dad owns a lot of them) No, I never even thought about it. Why? because I am not an insane nut job like that kid was.

No excuse can explain it, except for the fact that he was insane.[/quote]
I never thought of it like that, maybe the only cause of school shootings is insanity. Bullying and other stuff just adds on, or “triggers” this into violence.

Read full topic

He said he was doing it for the weak and defenseless, yet he killed the weak and defenseless.

So what? I have been bullied and made fun of, back around 5th grade or so I used to stutter sometimes in class and got made fun of because of it. I was also made fun of because my parents didn’t have as much money as some other kid’s parents did. Did I ever even consider bringing a gun or any other weapon to school and killing people? (I certainly had access to guns, my dad owns a lot of them) No, I never even thought about it. Why? because I am not an insane nut job like that kid was.

No excuse can explain it, except for the fact that he was insane.

item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Why do people always insist on finding a ‘cause’ for things? The kid was nuts, insane, crazy, something was wrong with his brain and that is it, there doesn’t need to be any other reasons.

Also I might add the kid was taking anti depressent and he was going crazy that by law the profesers can not tell about it unless the requesed be student

Read full topic

item.title: School Shootings
item.dc:creator: @mOPoTaToZ mOPoTaToZ
item.description:
@mOPoTaToZ wrote:

[quote=“TeraByte, post:13, topic:82681”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=121481.msg1201191#msg1201191 date=1177290633]
Why do people always insist on finding a ‘cause’ for things? The kid was nuts, insane, crazy, something was wrong with his brain and that is it, there doesn’t need to be any other reasons.
[/quote]
Because he was likely not nuts, insane, crazy, or had something wrong with his brain in the first place. If we can find a cause, maybe we can change the effect.[/quote]

If we find the cause, we can bring the 32 people back? No. Could finding the cause help prevent it again? Possibly. We already knew the cause. He warned them before he did it. There was a two hour window they could have taken the students out of the school, except for the two he shot before running off to the post office.

Another thing, the teachers and students admitted that he was made fun of and bullied. He was asked to read from a book out loud, and he had a speech problem, so the kids said “go back to china”. I’ve seen the video that was on NBC, and you can tell he DID have a mental problem, or was just very high. He contradicted himself many times. He said he was doing it for the weak and defenseless, yet he killed the weak and defenseless.

Read full topic

Very good point. No one would take 30+ lives then turn the gun to himself (that happend right?) and not be Insane Or Crazy/Wrong in the head…
Unless they were sick minded…Or very high.
I was thinking they might have been abused by parents? and then mayby bullied at school that made the guy snap? But anyway, this shouldn’t of happend, i think he must has been Nuts/insane/crazy or wrong in the head.
